definitions.definition: An angular mil , a unit of angular measurement equal to ⁄ 6400 of a complete circle. At 1000 metres one mil subtends about one metre (0.98 m). Also ⁄ 6000 and ⁄ 6300 are used in other countries.
A unit of measurement equal to ⁄ 1000 of an inch (25.4 µm), usually used for thin objects, such as sheets of plastic.
examples: For this task, I prefer the plastic sheeting that is 10 mils thick.

definitions.definition: A former subdivision ( ⁄ 1000 ) of the Maltese lira .

examples: We told her to give her daughter ten mils of cough syrup and to call us back if the cough gets worse.
For this task, I prefer the plastic bars that are 10 mils in diameter.
A dot in a mil-dot reticle represents one mil , which corresponds to a few inches at 100 yards.

main_definition: An angular mil , a unit of angular measurement equal to ⁄ 6400 of a complete circle. At 1000 metres one mil subtends about one metre (0.98 m). Also ⁄ 6000 and ⁄ 6300 are used in other countries.
secondary_definitions: A unit of measurement equal to ⁄ 1000 of an inch (25.4 µm), usually used for thin objects, such as sheets of plastic.
A former subdivision ( ⁄ 1000 ) of the Maltese lira .

examples: Word has it that they were offered a cool ten mil to sell their farm to the land developers.
